name: Eric Ruppert
content: Eric Ruppert Eric Ruppert I am an associate professor of computer science at York University. I am a member of the Theory of Computing Group. My research interests include Models of Distributed Computing Distributed Algorithms Computability and Computational Complexity In 2025, I am on the programme committee for PODC and WADS. Web page contents: Teaching Publications Contact Information Teaching In fall 2025, I am teaching EECS4115/5115 (Computational Complexity) and EECS4171 (Advanced Algorithms). Past courses: EECS/MATH 1019: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science (Winter 2006, Fall 2007) EECS 1560: Introduction to Computing for Mathematics and Statistics (Winter 2017) EECS 2001: Introduction to Theory of Computation ( Winter 2004, Winter 2005, Fall 2005, Fall 2007, Fall 2009, Fall 2010, Winter 2011, Summer 2012, Fall 2014, Summer 2015, Winter 2016, Fall 2016, Fall 2023) EECS 3101: Design and Analysis of Algorithms ( Summer 2001, Fall 2001, Winter 2002, Winter 2003, Fall 2008, Winter 2012, Fall 2015, Winter 2018, Winter 2020, Winter 2023, Winter 2025 ) EECS 4080: Computer Science Project course (Winter 2012, Summer 2019) EECS 4101/5101: Advanced Data Structures ( Fall 2002, Winter 2004, Winter 2005, Winter 2009, Winter 2019, Summer 2020, Fall 2022, Summer 2023, Fall 2024, Winter 2025 ) EECS 4115/5115: Computational Complexity ( Fall 2012, Fall 2020 ) COSC 6115: Computational Complexity ( Winter 2001, Winter 2009, Fall 2010, Fall 2012 ) COSC 6117: Theory of Distributed Systems (Winter 2002, reading version COSC6002 in Winter 2003, Fall 2003, Fall 2004, Winter 2006, Winter 2008, Fall 2008, Fall 2009, Fall 2011, Fall 2014, Winter 2016, Fall 2016, Winter 2023) CSC238: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science (University of Toronto; Summer 1998) The reason I'm glad I give exams to CS students rather than fine arts students.
